The claim made by Texas State Sen: Donna Campbell is that local government debt in Texas has increased nearly 40% in the past 5 years.
The claim is based on information from t: which oversees debt and debt financing across the state.
The report states that: local government debt issuance" has increased by 38.6% over the past five fiscal years, reaching $32.65 billion in fiscal 2018.
However: it is important to note that the growth in total debt held by local governments, or debt outstanding, has actually increased at a much lower rate of 17.7% to about $230 billion at the end of the 2018 fiscal year.
